column4: I have an old eee PC from asus, it only has 4gb of storage on it (solid state). What version, if any, can I put on it?
lubuntu would probably work well.. it takes about 2.x gigs w/ a full install
do i need a special install source?
a special source?
i see it now..
if you've got ubuntu-desktop, you may not have enough room to install lubuntu-desktop, id do a clean lubuntu install, but thats just me
yea, this think has windows.. I need to make a bootable usb on my other workstation.
lubuntu.net  download it and put it n a USB, and boot it and try it.
if you dont like it, no harm no foul.
Do I need to use the USB Disk Creator tool?
yes
download the Lubuntu ISO from lubuntu.net (i'd get 11.04), then use the USB disk creator to put the ISO on a USB, then boot the USB on the netbook.
thanks.. I also hear that the new Ubuntu 11.X had an eee-pc image inside it too.
or something similar.
i don't really know about that... it has a weird interface that i guess some may compare to some netbook interfaces (called Unity) but it sucks IMO..
The lubuntu iso doesn't seem to be liked by usb-creator.. not sure why.
it works fine, i've done it numerous times
for some reason when I click on it, the "make disk" greys out.
did the ISO completely download?
I think so, but I can't find any md5sums to compare
Should I dl the "mini.iso" for netboot instead of the full iso?
if you want
